Data Warehousing Concepts

Objectives of a Data Warehouse

  1. Unified Data Access: Eliminates heterogeneity across data sources.
  2. Consistency: Stores clean and consistent data.
  3. Historical Analysis: Allows queries across time dimensions.
  4. Actionable Insights: Provides tools for decision-making.

Strengths and Limitations

Strengths

  • Centralized data repository.
  • Historical trend analysis.
  • Multidimensional queries.

Limitations

  • High setup cost.
  • Complex integration processes.
